ngoList.title: Shambhavi School of Dance
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shambhavi School of Dance is born out of a vision of an art ecosystem that encompasses the need to preserve,celebrate and showcase the countless treasures of our performing arts with a focus on music,dance,theatre and folk art.Besides spreading out as a tree of life around which these arts can flourish,Shambhavi School of Dance by its very nature is designed to be an intellectual crucible that can shape the sensibilities of the public,set benchmarks in artistic standards and influence the very culture of art appreciation.Besides conducting various courses in dance,we strive to organise events that inspire new lifestyles and enrich lives with ARTS.The Shambhavi Dance Ensemble has won accolades round India for various performances.We wish to make a real difference in your life and the art scene in India.Dancejathre,Indias one and only International dance fair and Celebrate Dance series are the landmark festivals of our Institute.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Kuchipudi, one of the popular dance forms of India is different from the other forms. It was originally a dance drama technique called as Kuchipudi Bhagavatam / Yakshagana presented only by men. As mentioned in the literatures, siddhendra Yogi, the chief architect of kuchipudi trained a group of young Brahmin boys in this art form to tell stories from the Bhagavatam.. Even the feminine roles were played by men.. Kuchipudi also branched out as a solo form welcoming women into it.

Shambhavi School of Dance organized the World Dance Day Celebrations, in Bangalore, featuring performances by senior Gurus in Bangalore, a yearlong monthly dance series billed Celebrate Dance, featuring performances by young dancers at Shambhavi Dance Theatre, Bangalore. “Mulam” A National Seminar and Dance Festival on the theme Guru Shishya Parampara. This was held on 30th and 31st July at Bangalore.

The festival aims at driving cultural tourism and cultural diplomacy. To create more dancers, multiply the number of audience, support preserve and transcend the cultural richness of this land. Bridge the gap between the arts and the modern man. To encourage the young dance aspirants and give them the opportunity to know the real professional side of dancing and inspire more of them to take to dance profession with a professional attitude.

ngoList.title: Shantala Natyalaya Institute
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shantala Natyalaya Institute, a School of Performing Arts,which was established in 1989 at Belgau. This institute is a boon for dedicated students of Bharatnatyam, Carnatic Music, Mridangam, and folk dances of India.The Institute is proud that its highly-talented students have been honored with Balashree National Award for Creative Performance and Kalashree State Award. Receiving this prestigious award for 3 consecutive years is like a record for any Institute. As many as 20 students of Shantala Natyalaya have received CCRT Scholarship over the last 11 years which is an impossible milestone for an Institute. Shantala Natyalaya completed its 25 glorious years in 2014, which was celebrated on 26th, 27th, and 28th of December 2014 where internationally famed music and dance artists performed on all three days.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: MINISTRY OF CULTURE GOVT OF INDIA
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Shri Ramakrishna is known world over as the prophet of Harmony of religions. He recognized the differences between all religions but showed that they all lead to the same ultimate goal. His views were always based on real life experiences. In today’s strife filled society wars and conflicts are fought in the name of religious fundamentalism, threatening peace, prosperity and progress, sri Ramakrishna’s doctrine of harmony of religions holds immense importance.

Shantala Natyalaya has completed its 25 glorious years in 2014, which was celebrated on 26th, 27th, and 28th of December 2014 where internationally famed music and dance artists performed on all three days. Shantala Natyalaya Institute brought all the art forms like Bharatanatyam, Kathak, Mridangam, Karnatic Vocal Music, and Historical Dance Ballet based on the life history of Natyarani Shantala. All these sent a message to the society that there is unity in diversity by different artforms.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shantha Jeeva Jyothi [SJJ] was established as a non-government voluntary organization in 1988 by professional social workers and medical personnel. It aims to improve the overall status of socially and economically marginalized communities like people affected by leprosy, children, women, and youths and differently abled. The government of Karnataka enthusiastically allocated to SJJ a large area with the population of in 39 wards of Bangalore to undertake leprosy control works and Bangalore City Corporation offered an unutilized Health Center building to SJJ for its activities. Major activities include Elimination of leprosy as per the National Leprosy Eradication Programme, Govt. of India, Care and protection of children, Preventive and curative community health, Community based rehabilitation of people with disability and Socio-economic empowerment of marginalized women. Areas of intervention under leprosy and disability include awareness raising, case detection, treatment, prevention and management of disability and community based rehabilitation. Till date 3150 persons identified with leprosy cured of the disease. SJJ has also been promoting mother and child health through sensitization on preventive and curative health care, environmental sanitation by which around 1800 children and women benefited annually SJJ has been involved in care, protection and development of children in need of care and protection in Ramanagara district. SJJ promotes raising awareness on child rights, identification and intervention of victims of child right violations, networking and collaborating with the convergent programmes and organizations of the government and civil society. We work by organizing sensitization programmes in schools, communities, training and forming Child Rights Clubs, Task Force consisted of different stakeholders. It is entrusted as District Missing Children Bureau by the Government of Karnataka in 2010 to identify missing and unaccompanied children and re-unite them with their families and appointed as District CHILDLINE â€“ 1098 Collaborative Partner by the CIF-Government of India in 2016 for providing emergency interventions to children in need of care and protection in Ramanagara district of Karnataka. SJJ is also working to facilitate community based rehabilitation of people with disability [PWD]. One track addresses the empowerment of persons with disability through sensitization, referral, access to education and livelihood activities and on the other simultaneously capacitating the organizations of people with leprosy and disability to works towards breaking down the barriers causing their exclusion and marginalization. Women empowerment interventions seek to reduce social and economic marginalization among rural communities in Ramanagara district and in different slums of Bangalore through the processes of awareness building, forming SHGs, accessing to information, credit and resources, through participatory training The project enabling them to gain knowledge and skills to organize and assert themselves, have control over the resources, developing a strong ownership and creativity in solving problems. SJJ worked with the Bangalore City Corporation and the W.H.O. in an action research. Aims were to establish social determinants affecting Healthy Urbanization and suggesting development targets to civic agencies. The research brought out evidence based causes behind causes of deterioration of general health of people due to unsafe water and led agencies to initiate appropriate actions.

ngoList.title: Shanti Bhavan Educational Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shanti Bhavan is a unique and free residential school of excellence in Tamil Nadu for children from extremely poor backgrounds. Their parents are rag pickers, sewage workers, quarry labourers, house maids and without intervention they will go on to those same careers trapped in a cycle of poverty reinforced by barriers of class, education and geography. Every year we take twelve girls and twelve boys at the age of four for admisssion and our total enrollment is three hundred and fifty students. The Shanti Bhavan Educational Trust offers free high quality education for its students both at its residential school and subsequently at top tier college. we follow the ICSE and ISC curriculum a challenging set of quidelines and examinations usually reserved for elite preparatory schools. Our Students are given the skills and education to compete and excel at the very highest of levels. Shanti Bhavan is more than a school. It is a unique approach for educating poor children. Our commitment goes beyond education. In addition to their academics our children are treated to a program of complete holistic care carefully structured to teach them about arts,sports,leadership and world cultures. we provide complete medical and residential services to each child offering them the kind of environment they need to flourish. In total this is a seventeen to nineteen years of intense intervention per child from age four to twenty three. Our model has shown that by providing children with the tools to succeed at a very high level and by instilling in them the values of civic engagement that they then become change makers themselves going on to help their families,communities and other children in need. It takes just that one generation to break the cycle of poverty for these families. No other model of educational intervention commits the same level of long term and quality investment in the lives of children or holds more promise for their futures and those of their families. All children in the first nine batches of tenth graders passed ICSE examination in first class with majority of them getting distinctions. The seven batches that have graduated from twelfth grade in the ISC examination have also received first class and distinction. These children are studying in colleges of excellence including National law school Bangalore and Kolkata, Christ College, Mount Carmel College, Reva Univeristy, BMS Institute of Technology. Four batches of our students who graduated with Bachelor Degrees are working in multinational companies such as Goldman Sachs, Capgemini, Mercedes Benz, Deloitte, Infosys, Amazon, Yahoo, ANZ Grindlays etc.
